article_title: U.S.’s Kerry: Establishment of Buffer Zones in Syria Worth Considering
article_text:
WASHINGTON—U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry said Wednesday that a buffer zone along the border between Syria and Turkey is worth considering “very closely,” an indication that the U.S. and international partners may step more deeply into the region’s civil strife.

U.S. officials headed to Ankara this week to discuss Turkey’s role in an international coalition against Islamic State militants will discuss the idea of a buffer zone with Turkish officials, who have favored such a zone for several years to help manage...
